Poročil se je Napoleonov potomec
Princ Napoleon je večno zvestobo obljubil 31-letni avstrijski grofici. Ta je praprapranečakinja druge žene Napoleona Bonaparteja.
04 Nov 2019, 21:10 by B. K. P.



Levo mladoporočenca, desno njuna prednika, ki sta bila prav tako par.



Poroka je bila v Parizu. FOTO: Instagram


Da se zgodovina z ljudmi pogosto pošali, je dokazala nedavna poroka potomca slovitega francoskega vojskovodje in cesarja Napoleona III. Bonaparteja, ki se je poročil z daljno sorodnico Napoleonove druge žene. Jean Christophe, princ Napoleon, in grofica Olympia von und zu Arco-Zinnerberg sta se poročila v Parizu, v katedrali, kjer stoji grobnica Napoleona Bonaparteja, in tako po več kot 200 letih znova združila dve nekoč zelo pomembni evropski plemiški rodbini.


Poroka je bila v Parizu. FOTO: Instagram

Pariz ima za par prav posebno sentimentalno vrednost, saj sta se v francoski prestolnici tudi spoznala. Grofica Olympia je tam študirala, princa Napoleona, ki je takrat bival v Londonu, pa je spoznala na eni od zabav, na katero menda najprej sploh ni hotela. Zaročila sta se maja letos in 33-letnik je svoji dragi na prstanec leve roke nataknil 40-karatni diamantni prstan, ki naj bi menda nekoč krasil krono Napoleona III.»Da se zgodovini najinih rodbin prepletata, je bolj naključje kot kaj drugega. Ko sem spoznal Olympio, sem bil očaran nad njenimi očmi, ne nad njenim družinskim drevesom. Pravzaprav najprej sploh nisem vedel, da je modre krvi. Ko sva se pozneje spoznavala, sva ugotovila mnogo neverjetnih zgodovinskih dejstev, tudi najino povezavo izpred stoletij, a sva se temu le nasmejala,« je povedal Jean Cristophe.Ko sem spoznal Olympio, sem bil očaran nad njenimi očmi, ne nad njenim družinskim drevesom.Po cerkvenem obredu je sledila razkošna zabava v dvorcu iz 12. stoletja, ki sta se je poleg drugih pomembnežev udeležila tudi sveže zaročena princesa Beatrice in Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, ki si nameravata večno zvestobo obljubiti prihodnje leto.

He married a descendant of Napoleon
Prince Napoleon has promised eternal loyalty to the 31-year-old Austrian countess. She is the great-granddaughter of Napoleon Bonaparte's second wife.
04 Nov 2019, 21:10 by B. K. P.



Left the newlyweds, right their ancestors, who were also a couple.



The wedding was in Paris. PHOTO: Instagram


The recent marriage of descendants of the renowned French military leader and Emperor Napoleon III has proven that history is often shared with people. Bonaparte, who married a distant relative of Napoleon's second wife. Jean Christophe, Prince of Napoleon, and Countess Olympia von und zu Arco-Zinnerberg were married in Paris, the cathedral where Napoleon Bonaparte's tomb stands, and after more than 200 years reunited two once very important noble relatives of Europe.


The wedding was in Paris. PHOTO: Instagram

Paris has a particularly sentimental value for the couple, as the two met in the French capital. The Countess Olympia studied there, and met Prince Napoleon, who was in London at the time, at one of the parties that she did not want at first. They got engaged in May this year, and the 33-year-old put a 40-carat diamond ring on his precious left-hand ring, which was supposed to once adorn the crown of Napoleon III. "To coincide with the history of our relatives is more coincidence than anything else. When I met Olympia, I was mesmerized by her eyes, not by her family tree. In fact, at first I didn't even know there was blue blood. As we got to know each other later, we found many incredible historical facts, including our connection from centuries ago, but we just laughed about it, "said Jean Cristophe. When I met Olympia, I was fascinated by her eyes, not by her family tree. The rite was followed by a lavish party at the mansion from the 12th century, attended by, among other notables, the freshly engaged Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, who intend to promise eternal loyalty next year.
